intro: Atractantha aureolanata, commonly known as the golden-lanate atractantha, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
